page.title: 02Parish Council Meeting.
page.content: { June 1985 } The Annual General Meeting of the Parish Council of Hillfarrance and Oake was held in the Village Hall with approx. 25 people present. Councillor King outlined the principal concerns of flood alleviation, public footpath inspection and rights of way. He asked various speakers to outline developments in their own interests - the School Association, the Village Hall, the Acorn club, and the Hillfarrance Village Trust.The local vicar and the Taunton Deane councillor spoke. I was asked to comment on the Domesday Project. At the Parish Council meeting following, discussion arose about flood relief and the condition of the roads. The feeling of the meeting was taken about the addition of fluoride to water and was soundly opposed.
